website_summaries.verdict: Gives you the advantage of a slicker brush without the pain of cleaning it.
pros: This fine-tooth brush is easy to hold and easy to clean
Button allows the comb to retract and separate from the hair
Handle hold position allows you to get a wide and firm brush of your dog's coat without hurting your dog
Really removes a lot of excess hair quickly
cons: A big brush that might be a little difficult to use on smaller dogs

website_summaries.verdict: Suitable for any breed of dog and cats, too. An all-purpose brush that removes dead hair, mats, tangles. An excellent value.
pros: Wire pins effectively lift dead hair without scratching or hurting the skin
cons: Not the best choice for dogs with very fine or thin fur

customer_reviews.title: Best dog brush of this type I've ever found
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple dog brushes with these types of wires before. The best part about this brush is that the wires actually go back inside the brush when you're not using it. It makes it easy to clean so you're not bending in the wires while you're trying to get the hair out and it also makes it so the wires don't get bent when they're just in your basket or your drawer or where ever you keep your dogs brushes. Because the wires go back inside it protects them so that when you need to use it it does not scratch your dog. Excellent product highly recommend it to anyone with the pets especially who needs regular brushing!
customer_reviews.author: Little Lady

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, be careful
customer_reviews.text: First time leaving a review but I keep getting emails to write one so here I am. Did not work. I loved the idea of having the button there to get the hair off the brush, but the brush simply didn’t not get hair off of my dog. It also left scratches up my dog’s back after gentle use where the bristles are too sharp.so now my dog still needs to be brushed but I have to wait until his scratches heal so more damage isn’t done. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Description is a bit misleading
customer_reviews.text: The bristles stay retracted. You press the button to keep them out while brushing the dog. I don't have great hand strength so holding this button down while brushing my Great Pyrenees (lots of hair) just doesn't work well. I bought this brush expecting it would do what the image said that I'd push the button when it was time to remove the hair not the whole time I brushed.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Our dog hates this brush
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this brush. Our dog is desperately trying to get away from it. I think that it might be causing her pain even though we are trying to be gentle. Maybe this brush is only for dogs with very thick coats, but the info says that it is good for any type and your pet will love being brushed with it. That definitely wasn't the case for us.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Love, love this brush!
customer_reviews.text: My dog sleeps while I brush him. I have Arthritis and the handle is easy to grab. Easy to clean, just push button and is clean!
customer_reviews.author: Belgica B. Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst products I have ever purchased from Amazon! Maybe I just got a dud maybe not. It’s easy to make the bristles come out with the button but retracting them is a pain, to say the least! I finally had to hit the brush on a hard surface to get them to retract. Every time I tried ( about 8 times🥴🥴🥴) I had to strike the brush to get them to retract. I read all the reviews and watched the vid before ordering. Hate this piece of junk, don’t waste you money, even if it’s on sale. My Westie hated it too.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a few months with occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a few months with occasional use. The device worked well when new; it was easy to clean the hair off. Used it a couple times a week on one cat. The click function to extend and retract the bristles recently quit working. Now it only works if you hold the button in, which is not easy.
customer_reviews.author: MAD

customer_reviews.title: the quality and the design are wonderful. I have a great Pyrenees and I live ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the most fabulous product I have ever purchased in all my years of shopping with Amazon. This brush does exactly what it says it's going to do without problems...the quality and the design are wonderful. I have a great Pyrenees and I live in the mountains with lots of brush and burrs which are all brought into my house via my dog. Also forgot to mention I live on a creek so I have a wet Great Pyrenees who requires grooming daily. This brush gets a lot of use, is simple to use, and I am absolutely delighted..
customer_reviews.author: norrie

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform per pictures in reviews
customer_reviews.text: I tested this on my Brittany who's more than happy to turn wads of hair over to any brush, shockingly this device collected only a tiny bit. Be aware of any product that has a ton of 5 star reviews posted the same day - I missed that when I ordered. I'm sending this back and sticking with the furminator. I don't recommend this brush for anything other than smoothing a few stray hairs on a coat.
customer_reviews.author: iThinkYou'reFunny

customer_reviews.title: wire brush, no beads on the end of the wires
customer_reviews.text: I thought this brush had beads on the end but it does not. It is just wires and my dog doesn't really like being scratched with a wire brush that you could use to scrape paint off your house. I have another brush that does have the small beads on the end, and when you are done brushing you push the button to clean it. This brush is the opposite, you have to hold the button down the entire time. Once I tried it, we don't like it nearly as well as the other brush. May not keep this thing and I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with arthritis or hand pain problems
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because it is a neat idea but it is not for anyone who can't hold a button down continuously while grooming their pet. If you have arthritis or weak thumbs or fingers you will not like this product. Wish they had a way to double-click the button to have the teeth stay out while grooming. My only option is to tape the button down and untape it when done, so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: cat girl

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like a Furminator
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on sale and wanted to try a new brush for my cats since my cat Furminator has the hard edge not that my cats have ever complained. Well Im not sure if this slicker brush isn't meant for short-haired cats or what but I brushed my cat with it 3 times and didn't bring up one hair. Seriously irritated. Got out my furminator and used it on both cats and removed several balls of fur. Guess I should have stuck with what I had.
customer_reviews.author: ButterflySKJ

customer_reviews.title: We Love This Brush
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pet brush that does everything it promises to do. My dogs love this brush and I love peeling off that big sheet of hair off the brush and throwing it away! I also noticed that there is no flyaway hair when brushing your animal. I am going to order a second one of these because I never want to be without it again. Fabulous product. I am buying for gifts; sent my brother one for their 3 dogs and they think it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Corey C.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy
customer_reviews.text: The release button kept sticking when we first used it so we would have to hold the button down to keep the bristles out. When you do retract the bristles to remove the hair you have to wipe the hair away so you might as well just pull the hair out of a normal brush. I bought this and the FURminator at the same time and the FURminator get a lot more hair and when you hit its release button for the fur it falls to the ground. The FURMINATOR is a lot better than this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. This product is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is easy to clean but a total PAIN it use!!! You have to continuously hold down the button to keep the tines down. That makes it hard to brush and get to all places. Once you release the button, the hair is easy to remove. I think the thought was all wrong on this product. I would return it if I could now. It is of no use as no one in the house will use it. Lame design. Beware. The product picture shows the tines and button down but since there is no hand, you miss that part. Awful awful awful design.
customer_reviews.author: C. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Small Wiggly Dog Puts Fingers at Risk
customer_reviews.text: On one hand, this brush/comb is fabulous. It pulls the dead hair right out and is super, super easy to clean and remove the hairs from the brush. BUT those metal bristles are SHARP. My wiggly little dog managed to get me poked many times--and I couldn't help but wonder how many times she got poked, too. If I had a larger (less tight niches and areas to work in) and calmer dog, this might be a lot better. As it is, I don't use it nearly as much as I had thought I would. It HURTS when it puts several small bleeding holes in your fingers and hands. Probably pokes the dog, too. OUCH!
customer_reviews.author: Edna Renfield Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great for Goldens!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my golden retriever! I use an undercoat rake on her first to get all the hair out and then I smooth it out with this and she looks great!
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Handle Loosened After 10 (or so) Uses
customer_reviews.text: The handle loosened after an estimated 8-10 uses. I purchased this brush on June 23, 2017 (so 3 months and two days ago). I don't use it every day or even every week. I only use it when my dog is starting to look a little shaggy. I do like the brush mechanism and give it two thumbs up. The bristles retract nicely into the brush head and the fur cleans away nicely. But today the handle grip, which fits like a sheath over an interior handle section, slipped off. I am giving the product two stars because I don't think something this new and used so infrequently should come apart so soon.
customer_reviews.author: bhart

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I was having a hard time finding a brush that my elderly cat liked and finally found it. He had some small mats that I was able to get right out, with no pain. He looks great (see attached picture).
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Not for doodles..
customer_reviews.text: I have a 22 month old golden doodle with semi short fur. This brush left her bleeding in various parts of her body. The metal bristles are extremely sharp. I would not recommend this brush if you have a dog with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a large german shepherd who does what they do, shed everywhere. I had a slicker brush, but the pins were getting bent and it was time for a new one. This one is so much superior to what I had, and the best part is the button that retracts the pins. The hair effortlessly falls into the garbage can! No more digging at the brush trying to remove the hair. I've had mine several months, and it is still performing flawlessly. Very nice handle design as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy5311

customer_reviews.title: a bit difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar brush (which got chewed). And it worked great for my Brittany - a breed which is a notorious shedder. But with this brush, you have to hold the button down to extend the bristles, and then take your finger OFF the button in order to clean the brush...so it's clumsy to use. And if you don't keep your finger on the brush button the fur releases and gets all over. It probably wouldn't have bothered me, except I knew there was a better product out there. (The good news is they chewed up this brush also... so I'll be buying another of the other type of brush.)
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is amazing. I have a short haired Shepard and she LOVES this product AND it does the job! The photos explain it all!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unfriendly design
customer_reviews.text: This brush comes with a button you have to keep depressed in order for the bristles to be exposed so you can brush your pet! And self cleaning? Oh yeah...as soon as you let go of the button, the hair flies everywhere unless you have it enclosed in something. NOT A PRACTICAL DESIGN. Had I realized these things, I'd have never purchased it. I don't always watch any videos that may be available. So, my bad and I'll watch videos in the future. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Cece H.

customer_reviews.title: And okay product
customer_reviews.text: Mine got to me ripped out of its packaging ... ? The product itself was okay but it was as if someone tried to steal it, at first, or something. Otherwise, the retractable bristles are really nice and makes removing hair from the brush much easier. It's not a very a deep cleaning for double coated dogs though. My corgi needs to be brushed twice as long with this brush compared to the old brush I had. Plus, the plastic to the brush is ... well, cheep feeling. You drop this on the floor and it feels like the thing is going to fall apart. And at times, the bristle retract button does get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Huegel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for golden retriever
customer_reviews.text: I googled best grooming tool to help with shedding for my golden Retriever, & this came up over & over. Not disappointed! The cleaning feature is outrageously cool! Push button, prongs recede, swipe hair right off. Effortless! Love it! Even faster than furminator release, which I’ve been told aren’t good to use on Goldens anyway. Comfortable design, my only change would be that I would have preferred a slightly smaller head. My dog is large, but I feel with a smaller head surface I’d have more control around the tighter & more tender areas. But that’s just personal preference, it’s a great, flawless tool! Hope the push button prong receding feature never breaks, because it will get used a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: Brush your pets with ease !! This is a good buy !
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pet brush I have ever owned. I have three cats and have went through many brushes over the years. This one is the best one I have found. The cats enjoy being brushed with this. It gets to their undercoat and removes hair that would otherwise end up as a hairball on my carpet. The best feature is the push button hair release. It does hang up once in a while, but I merely tap it (gently) and the bristles pop into the base of the brush and the hair comes right off. I would highly recommend this to anyone who has pets that need brushing. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in South Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a amazing! I bought it for my short thin haired 1 year old cat who has never been brushed before. Lately he has been shedding a ridiculous amount of hair everywhere he goes so I figured this could help. This pulled so much loose hair off of him, I don't think he will have any left to shed and he is so shiny. He won't stop following me to brush him more and was meowing the whole time happy while getting brushed.
customer_reviews.author: Genny

customer_reviews.title: Rough on skin.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brush after reading reviews on it and several others. It does separate the hair cleanly and doesn't tear out the hair. The release button is plastic and I question how long before it breaks as I use it repeatedly when grooming my standard poodle. I am very unhappy that the brush is supposed to be gentle on the skin. I have bloody scratches on my hand from using it and I must be very careful how much pressure I use to prevent it from hurting my dog. Overall it's on par with most others. I will continue to search for one that REALLY doesn't cause bloody scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne F.

customer_reviews.title: BEST HAIR BRUSH I'VE HAD & EASIEST!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is beyond the BEST! Handles easy in my hands as well as my husband. Can use my right hand and his left hand. Use on my 4 rescue cats and not one fights me. Not hard bristles but get the job done. The best part is, when it's full of HAIR you push that button and the it pushes so the hair FORWARD. The hair then just peels right off!!! Soo EASY!! NO fighting with hair and pulling. You won't regret!! 😻😻
customer_reviews.author: 💜Southern Green Eyes 💜

customer_reviews.title: Very bad design
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated, the mechanism to release the pet hair is backward. You have to hold the brush and push and hold a button located at the thumb position in order to extend the bristles. If you let up, the bristles retract and any collected hair falls off. This would be fine if the button locked in place when pushed down. But, since it requires constant pressure, the thumb fatigues quickly (especially if your hands are weak, arthritic or both) . I will be putting this bad investment in the garage sale bin.
customer_reviews.author: walela

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Brush
customer_reviews.text: The bristles of this brush are supposed to eject out and back in at the click of it's button. The purpose of this is to easily remove the hair from the brush once the bristles have clicked back into the brush. However, the bristle don't come out of the brush flush with the base and come out at a slight angle leaving and bunch of bristles at weird angles and some don't some out at all. This is probably the biggest waste of $15 I've ever spent in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Martin

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this brush!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews--almost all favorable--and decided to purchase this brush for use on my 8-year-old domestic short-hair (DSH) cat. Although she is classified as DSH, her hair is abundant, grows fast, and sheds easily. So far, my cat and I are extremely happy with the brush. It pulls out the hair she is about to shed and is super-easy to clean. My cat has always preferred slicker brushes, so this one got a warm reception from her. However, other slickers can be too tough or sharp besides being hard to clean. This brush may cost a few dollars more than others that are not self-cleaning, but it is worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Carmine

customer_reviews.title: What's That
customer_reviews.text: I have a Treeing Walker Coonhound and after brushing her with the Hertzko Self Cleaning Slicker Brush I looked at my hand and in my mind, I asked: "What's That?" I had just released Ethel's hair from the brush and I was wondering . . . is there another dog in my hand or just hair? Ethel had enjoyed her brushing, my hand had not cramped, and I had all this loose hair in hand. What that means is I will have a lot less of Ethel's hair on my bed and favorite chair.
customer_reviews.author: Edson Flower

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews. When I received the brush I was not impressed as I expected a much wider brush, Bodie our german shepherd, is a large friend. My youngest son took the brush and started using it on him who I believe, must have been brushed twice a year at most. Bodie lay on the floor and thoroughly enjoyed the process which lasted for just a few minutes. The result: a happy and nice looking dog, hair amounting the size of a small soccer ball and easily disposed in the trash can, and no mess whatsoever. Impressive, very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I’m reviewing this based on two dogs brushed twice.
customer_reviews.text: I’m reviewing this based on two dogs brushed twice. Sooo.....will it hold up to long usage, or will I be buying a new one in a couple months. I’ll check back in a month or two if it fails. 3/14/20. I wish you sellers would stop asking for product reviews before we’ve even unboxed our prize! THE REVIEW: it works like a brush oughta, takes off loose hair, and thins the undercoat very well. Press till it clicks and it remains exposed for brushing, hold it over a can or other container press the button again it closes again dumping all of the trapped hair! MIRACLE, compared to what I was doing!!! Your mileage may vary!
customer_reviews.author: Charglie

customer_reviews.title: I used this on a horse and it worked TERRIFIC!
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly Arabian with an odd coat...when he sheds his summer coat it is hard to remove all the hair & "scurf" (dirt and dead skin cells) to get him slick and clean before his winter coat grows in. I was worried that the sharp little tines on this brush would irritate him but he LOVED it - and it was so easy to clean after every couple of strokes. Just push the button and the hair falls onto the ground in a neat little rectangle. Best grooming tool I've bought in years. I'm sure it will also aid in removing his winter coat when he sheds THAT. Highly recommend this gadget!!!
customer_reviews.author: GiddyYuppy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, effective, easy clean, with some small drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: Really great product. I have a very long haired Maine Coon mix, so there's a never ending source of fur. Other brushes haven't been ideal at getting all the extra hair off, but this one does a fantastic job. A few brushing sessions post-winter fur and there's already a substantial difference in her coat. She seems more comfortable and enjoys being brushed. It's also really effective at getting any mats out, ones that standard brushes don't touch. The handle is a little awkward, only comfortably brushes a certain way. Cleaning is literally a click and tap into the trash. Easiest cleanup possible. The bristles are a bit stabby, so don't use a ton of pressure. Overall, absolutely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: alicenite

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made brush, just a bit too rough
customer_reviews.text: This brush does indeed remove undercoat very well, and the cleaning is so easy and satisfying, it's actually enjoyable. My only qualm is that the brush points are very sharp, and it hurts skin (my dogs jump away and I tried it on myself, too). I see no necessity in such harsh skin abrasion in order for the brush to work, so I think it's an overlook on the company's part.
customer_reviews.author: xayc

customer_reviews.title: Our cat was a jerk before this
customer_reviews.text: Our cat, his Royal Highness, Benjamin, was a complete jerk before this brush arrived. He wants to be pet, but the second you touch him, he either bites or gets up and walks away like you're beneath him. A couple of swipes with this brush and he's suddenly begging us for it. And this cat does not beg. Ever. He will jump up on the couch, lay on my lap, head bump the brush, and cryyyy for more brushing! It's ridiculous. I don't know if I love it or hate it, but my cat isn't a jerk anymore and I'm happy about that. Benjamin, on the other hand, gives this brush 5 hundred solid gold stars. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JessDoo

customer_reviews.title: O.M.G.
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush so much. It freaking works just like they advertise. It isn't a gimmick. I have never in my life cleaned a brush so easily. You literally just push a button, the tines retract, and you just let it fall (or wipe off) into the trash. DONE. My dog doesn't mind it and even likes being brushed more now. And it freaking works. I have a german shepherd mix so it's kind of a big deal to me. I don't know how well it holds up overtime, but even if it lasts a year of steady use it will be money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: TEN STARS
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe my cats (and I) I have lived so long without this brush! It feels good (or so their purrs tell me), it's SUPER effective (undercoats-be-gone!), and cleaning is literally a snap. With the press of a button, the tines retract and you're left with so much fur you don't know how your pet isn't bald. There is ZERO cleanup for this brush - no fur gets left in the tines or jammed up inside. Just remove the alarming amount of fur from the end of the brush, pop the tines back out, and you're back at it! If you're shopping for a pet brush, stop now and just buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: nichme

customer_reviews.title: This product really works.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kerrie Blue Terrier who has a a double coat . The outer layer is wavy to kinky curly and the undercoat is similar to human hair in behavior. She is not a fan of grooming. This brush gets through to both layers of fur with a minimal amount of fuss. I don't think anything will ever make Kaila-Blu love being brushed but she is much happier with the Hertzko slicker brush than any other brush I have used on her. As for the cleaning. You won't believe how easy it is to remove the fur Press the button to retract the bristles and the fur slides right off the brush
customer_reviews.author: Fultonguy

customer_reviews.title: No discomfort and works so well!
customer_reviews.text: A great brush! I have a plush coat German shepherd puppy who has a hard time sitting still. This brush is gentle enough to not cause any discomfort, so it doesn’t startle her and I can brush her while she’s playing or eating without her getting irritated. It seems to detangle and remove stray hairs very effectively! The brush’s retractable bristles make it very easy to clean. If you have a dog with a medium or long coat, you’ll still need a comb to get close to their skin and prevent mattes, this is mostly for the top layer of fur, but it makes that top layer very soft! My fluffy puppy feels like a cloud after I groom her!
customer_reviews.author: Janèt Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Item
customer_reviews.text: Don't be like me read the instructions all the watch and the button - push it until it clicks - then do the brushing makes it so much easier. I contacted the seller and they were nice enough to let me know that it should click. I was really amazed at how much easier it is to brush my dog and then remove the hair from the brush. He seem to like it as well. I recommend this item folks!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Okay I was a skeptical at first when I saw it, but it’s so amazing! One, it’s easy to use with one hand so I can brush and clean it without having to let my cat go. Two, all the hair isn’t flying all around and in my face when I brush. It keeps it and is super easy to clean. Lastly and most important: I was away for a bit and my cat got handful of dreads that just would not budge. I just used this and brushed over the same spot and bit and they SLID RIGHT OFF! In seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Rondon

customer_reviews.title: This is nice
customer_reviews.text: Grooming your dog is a chore regardless of what kind of brush you use, this brush will make your life easier. This brush goes through the fur easily and pulls up all the hair down to the skin and on my retrievers it gets down to the fine undercoat. It also helps spread the natural oils throughout the thick coat. On my Lab, it removes the loose wire coat easily. Removing the fur is easy since you just press it and you brush is clean and you can simply toss it away. My Dogs really enjoy this brush, they will gladly come to you when you show it to them.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy

customer_reviews.title: "Best of the Best"
customer_reviews.text: I am a Police (ret) K 9 Trainer/Kennel Master/Handler, deployed in same capacity in both Iraq and Afghanistan with over 35 yrs. experience..Needles to say I have gone through and tried hundreds of grooming/slicker brushes over the span of my career. The "Hertzko Self Cleaning Slicker Brush is by far the best tool I have used to groom, remove hair and "bring out" the natural oils/shine of the dogs coats that I have ever used. Will always be my "go to" brush. Buy it! THE HERTZKO SELF CLEANING SLICER BRUSH" This brush is second to none.. !!.. You and your dog/dogs will be happy you did! Joe D.
customer_reviews.author: JOE

customer_reviews.title: Best slicker brush
customer_reviews.text: This is the best slicker brush I've used! I got this for my new Afghan Hound. I ran this across my own skin first to make sure it wouldn't scratch her skin sense her coat is short and it is very sensitive. This brush gets out tangles very quickly and is so easy to clean! I have used other self cleaning slickers before, but the tines always bend and get stuck. I haven't had that problem with this brush. That combined with the price and I'm in love with it! I'd recommend this brush for everyone and plan to get a smaller size for our lionhead bunny.
customer_reviews.author: PeculiarOwl

customer_reviews.title: retractable bristles is a great feature
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab that sheds like crazy. When I brush him the bristles immediately get clogged, but since this brush has retractable tines, it's easy to clean off the fur. I dont think a normal brush would even work with his coat. That being said, I think the tines are a bit stiff for my dog. When I brush him he gets tickled (especially around his belly) and he involuntarily shivers and tries to run away. So in the end, this brush is good for the brush-er, but not so good for the brush-ee. I think that if your dog is not affected by the tickley tines, then this is the perfect brush.
customer_reviews.author: Andy T

customer_reviews.title: It’s Magic!
customer_reviews.text: My havanese now allows me to groom her around her neck, chest and ears. She still squirms but no longer runs away. It’s only been 5 days so hopefully she will stop squirming as she gets more comfortable with this brush. I am satisfied with the amount of fur/hair removal. Going slow and easy is soothing for both of us. Cleaning the brush is a snap, just a push of the button. The bristles are sharp so you have to be careful. I also ordered a smaller self cleaning slicker brush with round tips on the bristles so I can easily do her belly, legs and face without worrying about hurting her.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good product for Pyrenees
customer_reviews.text: My dog is always nervous with new things and this was no exception. She wouldn’t let us near her with this thing. After getting her to lay and settle in with her favorite treats, we were able to use it on her. We couldn’t believe the amount of undercoat coming off of that dog. It was getting hair that the other brushes just couldn’t get to. And we were able to waste no time because just a click of a button emptied the brush of hair and then we were right back to it. We got her groomed in no time and now it’s her favorite brush.
customer_reviews.author: YerFace

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller amts fur w/ a lot static electricity
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 short hair cats recently. Every 2 weeks or so they hack up fur ball. The Defurbillator, which if used successfully on my other cats doesn't seem to get much off the new guys. What little it did get was hard to get off by fingers due to static. This item combs much more off, then retracting the wire enables me to knock off a bunch of hair too big to be bothered by static electricity. My only objection, is that I wish it was narrower. My cats are only 7 lbs, so there's not a lot of flat surface to comb. I would definitely recommend it. I was not compensated in any way for this review.
customer_reviews.author: hidden-smiles

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: we have an American Eskimo/Pomeranian. He has a very thick undercoat. He hates to be brushed. He does not mind this at all. We go slow and carefully. We are amazed at how much hair we can get out with this and with a click of a button, we wipe off the hair. It is so much better than the brush we have had for years where the pins would get pushed down. It was so much harder to clean and we had to keep pulling the pins up again. We would like another one but a smaller size so we can get under his belly better. Do they make one?
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H

customer_reviews.title: Best and last dog brush you will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical on buying this brush because i have gone through many brushes before. The reviews were good so I figured I tried. Wow amazing! Highly recommend this brush. My dog sheds and she’s a lot. Mostly on her back side. Just a few strokes the amount of hair that came off was crazy. The best part of it is you press one little button and the bristles go inside and the hair just stays on top and you wipe away! No more hurting your fingers while trying to get the hair out of the bristles. It’s so easy now!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: quick work
customer_reviews.text: I had what amounted to a comb to keep my pup's hair soft and smooth. He didn't really like it (nipped at us) and it took a long time to do his small 7 pound frame. Got this and cut the brushing down to 1/10 the time and he actually likes it. It doesn't pull at his hair like the comb, so I guess he doesn't feel like it is hurting him. Even the kids love doing it. Plus, we do it more often now that it is easy and quick. Press of the button and voila, all the hair come loose for you to toss in the trash. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Most efficient grooming brush
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pet brush I've ever purchased. Using it gently on my short haired Chihuahuas and Doxie is removing the loose shedding hair that would otherwise be all over my home. The wire bristles work so well to get the excess hair out and the push button hair release is a really nice addition, so you don't have to pick the hair out. My longer haired Doxie and Pom feel like they're getting a nice back scratch while I'm ridding them of all that loose undercoat. Great purchase, my pups are loving it and my home will stay much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Marti

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy brush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush for our chocolate lab. We had a very similar one before and it was very old and finally broke. This one is actually better bc the teeth retract and then the hair is just freely sitting on the head to be thrown away. The other one pushed the hair out so you still had to pull it out of the teeth. This is a lot easier. It works very well and is a low maintenance brush. It does fee like the teeth are quite sharp. I’m sure our older brush was just dull. We are making sure we are gentle with it as it doesn’t take much pressure to brush with
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats and dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I really the like this pet brush! I have 4 cats (1 long haired, 3 short haired) and 1 cat (lab/pit mix short haired). This brush seems to work on all of them and the ability to pop the bristles back in makes clean up so easy!! The only thing is that with my dog, her hairs don’t seem to stick into the bristles. They just kind of fly away, but honestly, I don’t think that’s the brushes fault lol. It may be more useful to brush her after a bath, that way the hairs might stick to the brush better! But I will continue to use this brush and recommend it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Self-cleaning Pet Brush
customer_reviews.text: I had not used a wire brush on my current animals, except for a kitten brush that had rubber protection for their skin. My two dogs do not think it feels like a brush (non-wire bristles), and my cat has always avoided being brushed. I am keeping this brush to keep trying to use it with the dogs, with a very light touch. I don't think I was too firm at first, but it was not a feel that they liked at first try. I do like the ease of cleaning all hair out of the brush, and think I will keep trying with them, a little at a time.
customer_reviews.author: JoyS

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Freaking Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. A brush for $15. But my little clumpy cat who doesn’t groom herself needed it. One sitting of brushing turned her into a silky smooth kitty again instead of feeling like a dirty shag carpet. I am completely amazed. It was easy to use and my cat who usually does not care for brushing at all, absolutely LOVED it. She actually enjoyed it and rolled over so I could get her other side. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Coffman

customer_reviews.title: This Product Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: With two long haired cats - one with triple fur layers and two Australian Shepherd mix dogs, I'd given up on ever being able to get them all brushed and have the knots out after brushing. But when I used the Self-Cleaning Slicker Brush, my dreams came true. It got all the hair, the knots and smoothed out coats. The animals all really liked being brushed with it, too. Not only that, it took half the time to brush as it had been taking. The retracting bristles for cleaning was just icing on the cake. If you're looking for a good brush for thick-furred, long-haired pets - this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Espy

customer_reviews.title: Mini spa experience that is a joy to use on our cats
customer_reviews.text: Picks up hair and is super easy to remove using the retractable teeth button. When you first introduce the tool, be sure to pet their backs with one had then follow it with the other hand, holding the brush. Repeat hand/brush pets until they are comfortable. They'll look at you like WTF, but eventually, they'll love the thing. Be sure to get enough of their own hair on it so they can smell it and identify it as a friendly familiar object. Before you know it, they'll be rubbing their cheeks on it if you leave them alone with it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Easy, gentle, and clean
customer_reviews.text: O my goodness. This came in today and with 5 minutes I was in love! My old doggy is a big crybaby who hates getting his hair brushed. This worked wonders on him and is so gentle he actually laid down while I brushed him. Plus the brush catches all the hair so it’s not all over as you brush. The only trouble I had was the tiny click it makes when you retract the bristles to clean out the hair. My old boy stood up and walked off when he heard that, but that’s only because he’s skiddish. He walked not ran so that’s a fantastic sign!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush, but too big for small dogs and some cats.
customer_reviews.text: This is brush is nice. It would be great for medium and large dogs and large long hair cats. For most cats you can’t really use it for all parts of the body because it’s huge. It’s a very large brush. I can do the back and sides of my larger cats. But I can’t do underneath, chest, etc. I don’t think you can really use it at all on a small cat as it’s just too big. I gave it four stars because it’s a nice brush for the right size animal. I just took one star because I bought it for my cats and it’s not really suitable for a thorough grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feel for the dog, and very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Young Sheltie, beautiful coat, and anticipating the spring flood of fur —how do you take care of this without making the Sheltie miserable? This self cleaning slicker brush is part of the answer. The strong, springy needlelike teeth pull smoothly through her outer coat, reaching down to the undercoat where the shedding is taking place. She seems puzzled by how good it feels! Cleaning really is a snap: push the button, the teeth retract, and the fur comes off in a nice woven clump. Could NOT be easier! The sound the mechanism makes (a loud snap) startles my dog just a bit, but she's getting used to it. This brush is a great way to finish our evening grooming sessions.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. MccaffreyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd. Dog sheds two more dogs out of him. I use this brush with another comb (Paws Pamper Professional Anti-Corrosion Grooming Comb) and that works for my dog. I use the comb to sort of part the hair (to get it out of the way) and use the brush to brush under and out in different directions to get that shedding hair out. My dog was standing still most of the time when I used this brush on him. The bristles retract so it was quick to get the hair out without stopping much in between brushing the dog. I love this brush!
customer_reviews.author: xxx

customer_reviews.title: Does its duty
customer_reviews.text: My cat isn't used to the brush but also isn't appalled by it. When I brush her, it does its job by getting fur. The button doesn't stay pushed (it's loose) in the way that the combs would be out but the button can still move. Does not bother me though. When cleaning the fur, it was pretty effective. When I retract the comb, most of the fur sits on top and I can brush it off with my hand. However, there are some that stay stuck to the comb and is harder to clean but you can't expect it to work perfectly ya know. I'd say it was a pretty worthy investment.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: My outdoor cats LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: We live on a farm and many people "drop" their cats/kittens out here so we do our best to keep them healthy (cat feed is expensive) and take them to our vet to get the their annual shots, etc. We never asked for it, but I am an animal lover. Recently had 9 kittens in our horse barn, 5 were still born. The other 4 have became "babies" and all are wonderful cats. The one we named SnowBall and she finds the groomer and meows when she wants to be groomed! Lots of hair, and the comb is so gentle and easy to clean - RECOMMEND IT HIGHLY!
customer_reviews.author: Ila J

customer_reviews.title: My Pets Love This Brush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush for my dog and he absolutely loves it. My dog is a bit of a baby and he doesn't like being brushed or groomed normally. It only took a few brushes and he became like putty in my hands. He even let me brush his paws and face. My short haired cat wanted in on the action too. I was able to remove a ton of hair from both pets and I noticed a significant decrease in their shedding. The added feature of retracting the bristles to easily remove the fur from the brush is a definite bonus. I would highly recommend this pet brush!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Arzoumanian

customer_reviews.title: Not for cats!
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Delivery was fine, etc. Seems like an okay design if you never bend any tines. The real problem was that it’s huge—far bigger than I expected. The poorly Photoshopped images show it totally out of proportion, and make it appear much smaller than it actually is. Marketing this for anything other than a large dog is simply deceptive advertising. I went with a Hartz brush with no retraction for a third of the price.
customer_reviews.author: klpharoah

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd Dog, Pomeranian, and a Golden doodle. I just got the doodle. He has tight curls like a poodle so, at the behest of a grooming article. I bought this brush to keep them soft and mat free. I LOVE this brush!! It works on all three dogs really well. SO amazing. My Pom is skittish when he hears it pop but, otherwise it is fantastic. I wish I had it 10 1/2 years ago when I got the Shepherd. He doesn’t mind this brush much at all and he really hates being groomed. You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri M Edwards

customer_reviews.title: It gets the hair off my pet with ease
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to be brushed with this wire brush. It grabs the excess hair off of her and so easy to clean. There is a button at the top of the handle which retracts the wire bristles and leaves the hair for you to swipe off quickly. I’m so glad there is a brush this easy to use that is so efficient in removing my pup’s excess hair before she leaves it all over my home. Anyone who has a shedding pet, needs this brush. Less shedding in my home, more outside to keep unwanted critters away.
customer_reviews.author: FlaBuyer57

customer_reviews.title: The issues have been resolved. GREAT JOB—- GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Overall this brush is a good idea but needs tweaking. It does a good job brushing a friends dog for whom I “sit” occasionally. She loves being brushed. My biggest problem is the difficulty of holding the little knob with just the right pressure over an extended time. I’ve tried using both my index finger and thumb but very difficult. Not sure how to do it; but it would work much better if you could lock in the various depths the bristles extend & retract and not have to keep depressing that button/ knob. Very frustrating. I have since bought 5 more. Animals LOVE it
customer_reviews.author: Nana from Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Just starting
customer_reviews.text: We have a new dog, Kimber, from a foster. She has extreme shyness and my daughter is working with her. Kimber is not thrilled with the brushing, I am sorry to say I think she has had little if any personal care. Kimber is getting along well with my daughter and slowly things are happening. Kimber's coat is not a long one so we have time to ease in. The brush is easy to handle and little bits can be done. Wish us luck that we can ease her into this and she will be cuddling and asking for skritches soon.
customer_reviews.author: J M Strasser

customer_reviews.title: The Only Grooming Brush You’ll Ever Need!
customer_reviews.text: Having rescued cats starting in 2007, I have tried finding the “perfect” grooming tool and they have generally been adequate but far from exceptional. This brush is indeed exceptional!! It is, without a doubt, the only self-cleaning pet grooming brush that works amazingly well, takes no time to clean and I would highly recommend! I am SO impressed with how great it works so there is literally no cleaning needed after using. It makes the grooming process a fun experience for both my kitties and especially me!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love this brush, it does a good job,  I wish my dog liked it better
customer_reviews.text: This brush certainly makes it easier to keep clean. It works as far as removing the hair well but it is a bit large to use on a small breed puppy. My pomeranian puppy hates it, even if I give treats while I am brushing her. I don't think it is the brush, although it isn't as comfortable as some people seemed to report. However it does work well and it is a breeze to clean. When she got into a sticker bush last week I was easily able to brush them off of her with this brush and then clean it very easily into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: S. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Too sharp for cat. He's likes it sometimes and hates it others.
customer_reviews.text: The cleaning feature is a god send. However i think the bristles are too sharp. Sometimes my cat likes it (for short periods, unlike his other brushes that he will fall asleep to and literally push against him with his paw) however other times it seems like it hurts him. I'm careful not to brush hard but it either pokes him or pulls his hair out uncomfortably. I only use it for very short periods to groom his shedding hair away and only as long as he lets me before meowing his annoyed meow.
customer_reviews.author: RuXuS

customer_reviews.title: Bristles don’t hold and go into brush
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (Sep 13, 2020) Updating my review because the seller reached out to me and offered me a full refund for the damaged brush. Great customer service and the new brush I bought is working great and is pretty amazing. Definitely recommend it. I had very high expectations for this brush based on the reviews but unfortunately I wasn’t lucky. After just a few uses, the bristles no longer hold in place and instead go into the brush at the lightest pressure making the brush absolutely useless. I can’t return it now that I’ve used it a few times so I’m stuck with the product now.
customer_reviews.author: Keyla

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Brush!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a brush similar to this one for a very long time and it's very old and has lost several of it's bristles so I thought it was time to get a really nice brush, and this is it. It is such a breeze to use and clean. It really gets all the way down through the hair. I brush very easily because the new bristles are very sharp and with little to no effort it goes all the way through. It's a really nice brush, I like it and my "fur babies" like it too! When cleaning, the hair just slides off the brush, you don't even have to touch it, so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J Holyfield

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I bought this to keep my cat's hair from getting everywhere. It certainly does help gather it at the source and couldn't be easier to clean. Even if you put those two very important positive things aside though, it is still the best. My cat absolutely loves it. I think being brushed by this is probably his favorite thing period. My cat has short hair, so it might be a different story with a long-haired cat. Really though, for me, even at double the price this would have been a deal.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Long Haired Cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat creates daily fur mats and is not good at self grooming. At age 18, I think she has just given up. I brush her daily with a soft brush, but once the mats form, I usually have to try to cut them out, which is a trauma for both of us. This slicker brush really helps stop the beginning mats from forming and is also super easy to clean. She tolerates it well, even when I am brushing the underlying mats. I end up with a lot of fur in the brush and her overall coat is much smoother. Glad I took a chance on this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Derzunk

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for fur parents! 🐶🐱
customer_reviews.text: I have a Pomsky puppy and she is the first long-haired dog I’ve ever owned so I’m new to brushing a fur ball’s coat. I’m so glad I found this because the amount of fur that I get out of a few strokes would be a nightmare to have to get out of a regular brush. This brush has a simple retracting button, and I can release all the fur from literally the push of a button. It can be done with one hand while I am comforting my pup with my other hand. Totally a great buy and it comes HIGHLY recommended by me!
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves This Brush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush and the glove, to replace similar ones we previously had but lost during our move. Our 8-year-old ASH male black cat started over grooming about a month ago, and started having hairball problems. He likes the Hertzko brush best. When I say "brush", he comes to me, and purrs the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: South Florida Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grooming tool!
customer_reviews.text: Got the brush and put it immediately to work on my two very shaggy Cairn Terriers. Their groomer has been closed because of Covid and they are a mess. This is the best for getting through shaggy coats and getting out all that loose hair. If Cairns aren't brushed they look awful because they are minimal shedders. Their other brushes just couldn't do the job with such shaggy coats!! They look so much better. I also went over my mini Doxie with it and he loved it. It's well worth its price. My only complaint is that I had to wait longer than usual for delivery. But, the wait was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves this Brush
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this brush! I only have to hold the brush still and she will do all the rubbing. It is also very easy to clean! The brushes retract into the head, which makes it so easy to clean as the fur stays out of the tracks. The only downfall with this is the bristles are very thin and very sharp at the tips. I am hesitant to comb around my cat's eyes in fear of poking her with them. This concern isn't enough to reduce my 5-star review, but more a suggestion if they are being redesigned at some point, maybe to have rubber tips put on each bristle or something to dull them.
customer_reviews.author: ROConnor

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this brush!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this brush for about a month now, and it's working really well. I've always found it kind of yucky to clean off a cat brush (especially when my cat has fleas), and this is so easy because I can clean it off without even touching it. My cat has very thick fur, and we're trying to conquer the flea problem. She cooperates well with this brush. I think because it really gets at the undercoat and feels more comfortable than the single line comb. I'm glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Not for short straight coats...if short, needs to be dense
customer_reviews.text: When products try to over identify with every customers needs it costs them money in the long run...especially when they could just create a separate product for different subcategories. I have a bull boxer with short straight hair. This is also my first dog. My entry into deshedding was hearing that it helps decrease shedding on furniture and indoors. So off I went looking for a “deshedding” brush. This one had high reviews and at the time was marketed for pretty much all fur types... When it arrived, I immediately realized my error.
customer_reviews.author: Ak

customer_reviews.title: This brush is so fabulous, I am so upset I didn't find this 2 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: This brush is so sweet and simple to use. It really cleans deep down into the coat and pulls unwanted (let's just say) dead hair and it just pops off the brush with just one push of the button. The other brushes were kind of rough and it was a serious chore to to get the hair out. This brush the hair falls off like melted butter. The dog is not so squirmy either, which means it's softer on his skin.
customer_reviews.author: BADBAX

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but need more brushes to do the job
customer_reviews.text: I have a labrador mix and this is one of 4 (yes 4) brushes I use to get her coat looking nice and prevent her from itching too badly. The brush is REALLY good at being easy to clean but even if I've knocked loose a whole bunch of hair that needs to just be collected, this brush only does an "okay at best" job of grabbing it. It is pretty gentle on her sensitive skin but it is probably the third place for one she likes best. Overall, it is a useful tool but is far from being the end-all-be-all brush to keep your dog looking nice and well groomed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hirleman

customer_reviews.title: The best thing ever created
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about four different brushes this year. Both my dogs are part German Shepherd... and if you have one.. you know that your house is COVERED in hair if you don’t brush them regularly. It’s such a hassle though and I have spent so much month on fancy brushes and this thing is so efficient idk how it’s not in more places and bigger!! I just bring a bag next to me and brush my dogs and it’s so much faster and soooooo much easier. I’m so happy I have this. I recommend it to everyone with dogs
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My Beagle-blue-heeler LOVED IT
customer_reviews.text: Removes hair fantastically, but the down side of the product is you have to hold the button down the keep the bristles out while brushing. This can get tiring! I have fibromyalgia, so if my hands are acting up I can only brush for 5 minutes. This is why I’ve made it 4/5 stars. This definitely get the fine hair from the shedding undercoat, so I love that! Performance is great, but if you are older or have hand problems, you may only be able to use this brush a little at a time. I luckily have a medium sized dog, so I got most of the problematic shed areas cleaned up on her before getting sore!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Last Pet Brush You'll Buy. For Cats, Too!
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated to be brushed until I bought this brush! Now, I just click the loud button that releases the hair and she comes running to be groomed. Looking at it on the computer, I thought it might be too big and clunky for a cat, but it's a great fit. By clicking the button, you retract or extend the bristles. I do wonder how long this mechanism will last. I also wonder if the bristles might bend and have trouble retracting to release the hair. Still, I love this brush so much that if it fails, I'll buy another just like it. My cat and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Someone AstonishingTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.  Goes catch lots of hair.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. First time I used it I was afraid to hurt my cat. The coms are very stiff and pokey. But began gently and she didn’t mind it. Once we were done and retracted the combs. We had tons of hair. More than her usual brushing. She looked not only shinier but skinnier too. Since she’s an indoor/outdoor cat I brush her often. The button to retract the combs seems to get stuck more often now. Haven’t had it more than 2 months. But does work. Button isn’t easily pushed either, would be hard for someone with issues with their hands. Makes a popping sound when you push the button. My cat doesn’t like the sound.
customer_reviews.author: A Fam of Smart Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp, not for short haired animals!
customer_reviews.text: The description says "gentle" and usable on all coat types, but the brush is super sharp and hurts my dogs. I have 2 large pitties... generally chunky, dopey bulldozers, who don't realize how strong they are, but they cringe when I try to use this brush + straight leave the room. It ripped up one of their skin pretty hard and I was barely touching him with it. It really is only suited for dogs/cats with thick coats + undercoats. The product is fine, but seller needs to change the description to reflect how serious this brush is!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Thompson

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a American short hair cat who loathes being brushed, but he doesn't seem to mind this brush as much as the other slicker brushes I've tried. Plus, this is one makes cleaning the bristles SO much easier. I don't have to worry as much about finding cat fluff dusty bunnies everywhere. His coat feels very soft and smooth and he isn't shedding as much as he was before. He even purred when I brushed his back with this brush. I would recommend this brush. Why stick yourself in the fingers (without actually removing all the hair) when you can just use this brush?
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Seller should have said "Not for short haired dogs".
customer_reviews.text: I was starry eyed by the retracting bristles feature of this brush. Used it lightly on my short haired fox terrier. She seemed to not enjoy the metal tines on her skin even though I so lightly brushed her. Pressed the button to retract the brushes tines, which worked great, but the static electricity caused by the brushing made my dog's hairs stick to the plastic of the brush like crazy. The seller should have emphatically said that this brush was not good and not meant for short haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: greenpeepers

customer_reviews.title: Get this brush.
customer_reviews.text: This self cleaning slicker brush is awesome. My dog has a really thick undercoat, and the self cleaning function on this brush makes it super easy to finish a brushing session quickly. I use the slicker brush as the finishing brush for when I brush out my dog. This brush helps a lot because you don't have to spend any time picking fur out of the pins, you just push a button and the fur stuck in the pins falls off the brush. Also, it makes storing the brush without damaging the pins.
customer_reviews.author: Dai Masters

customer_reviews.title: Hertzco Slicker Brush
customer_reviews.text: Hertzko Slicker Brush is larger than I thought, so a bit big for cats, although they seem to like it. It removes more hair from my shorthaired cats than the long-haired cat. It's kind of hard to depress the button to clean, but that could be due to my arthritis. I think this particular brush is more suited to dog owners, the larger surface seems better for a bit larger animal. It's definitely good at self cleaning, if your have no trouble with depressing and impressing the button.
customer_reviews.author: Dee T

customer_reviews.title: Great for Removing Tangles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a cat that has long fur and as she has aged, she has developed tangles in her fur that I need to remove. This brush does an amazing job removing lose fur and tangles. The design makes it easy to clean off the fur you brushed. My only complaint is that the brush is a bit of an odd size. I would say it is perfect for a medium size dog. It is a touch large and awkward for a cat (which is fine, I'll make due as it still works great), and it would be too small for a large dog.
customer_reviews.author: TheMadMan

product_meta.title: Hertzko Self Cleaning Slicker Brush – Gently Removes Loose Undercoat, Mats and Tangled Hair – Your Dog or Cat Will Love Being Brushed with The Grooming Brush
feature_bullets: ★ THE PERFECT BRUSH TO GET ALL NASTY MATS OUT OF YOUR PET’S FUR – Hertzko’s Slicker Brush gently removes Loose Hair, and eliminates Tangles, Knots, Dander and trapped Dirt. WORKS GREAT ON DOGS AND CATS WITH ALL SIZES AND HAIR TYPES!
★ GET RID OF MATS WITHOUT HURTING HER - The bristles are FINE bent wires designed to penetrate DEEP into the coat and is really able to groom the undercoat well without scratching your pet's skin!

★ EASY TO CLEAN – When you’re done brushing your pet, Simply click the button and the bristles retract back into the brush, Making is SUPER SIMPLE to remove all the hair from the brush, So it’s ready for the next time use.

★ YOUR PET WILL NOT ONLY ‘LOOK’ GOOD BUT ‘FEEL' GREAT TOO! – Our brush Grooms and massages for a healthy coat, increasing blood circulation and leaves your pet’s coat soft and shiny. Your Pet will love being brushed !
★ COMFORTABLE, STRONG, AND DURABLE- Our Slicker Brush is especially designed with a COMFORT-GRIP and ANTI-SLIP HANDLE, which prevents hand and wrist strain no matter how long you brush your pet !
